intro: Impatiens ankaranensis, commonly known as the Ankaranensis touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and its stems are often hairy as well. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
